sen.j: 大井荘（おおいのしょう）は、奈良時代～室町時代にかけて美濃国にあった荘園。
sen.e: Oi-no-sho Estate was a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) existed in Mino Province during Nara Periods and Muromachi Periods.
Oi-no-sho Manor was a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) existed in Mino Province during Nara and Muromachi Periods.
Oi-no-sho Manor was a shoen (manor in medieval Japan) existed in Mino Province during Nara and Muromachi Periods.
It was an estate of Todai-ji Temple.
It was an estate of Todai-ji Temple.
It was an estate of Todai-ji Temple.
Anpachi Country, Mino Province
Anpachi District, Mino Province,
Anpachi District, Mino Province,

sen.j: 現在の岐阜県大垣市付近。
sen.e: Vicinity of present Ogaki City, Gifu Prefecture
The vicinity of modern-day Ogaki City, Gifu Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文を反映するように書換え
sen.e: The vicinity of modern-day Ogaki City, Gifu Prefecture.
About 517.22ha as of the late 10th century.
About 517.22ha as of the late 10th century.
About 517.22ha as of the late 10th century.
Origin
Origin
Origin

sen.j: 天平勝宝8年（756年）に聖武天皇が東大寺に施入。
sen.e: In 756, Emperor Shomu presented the estate to Todai-ji Temple
sen.cmt: 施入→定訳不明：presented the territoryとしました。
sen.e: In 756, Emperor Shomu presented the manor to Todai-ji Temple.
In 756, Emperor Shomu presented the manor to Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 建武 (日本)年間、東大寺の鎮護神である手向山八幡宮を歓請する（現大垣八幡神社）。
sen.e: During the Kenmu era, the guardian deity of Todai-ji Temple, Tamukaiyama Hachimangu Shrine was requested to be transferred to the estate (present Ogaki Hachiman-jinja Shrine).
sen.cmt: 歓請→定訳不明：be requested to be transferred としました。
sen.e: During the Kenmu era, the divided guardian deity of Todai-ji Temple, Tamukaiyama Hachimangu Shrine, was transferred to the manor (present Ogaki Hachiman-jinja Shrine).
sen.cmt: コンマを補足原文の「歓請」を「勧請」に修正し、書換えしました。「estate」→「manor」
sen.e: During the Kenmu era, the divided guardian deity of Todai-ji Temple, Tamukaiyama Hachimangu Shrine, was transferred to the manor (present Ogaki Hachiman-jinja Shrine).
Todai-ji Temple
Todai-ji Temple
Todai-ji Temple

sen.j: 事実上の支配者は開発領主大中臣信清を祖とする大中臣氏だが、鎌倉時代に内紛で没落した。
sen.e: The practical dominator was the Onakatomi clan, a descendent of kaihatsu ryoshu (local notables who actually developed the land) ONAKATOMI no Nobukiyo, however the clan collapsed due to an internal conflict.
The actual ruler was the Onakatomi clan, a descendent of kaihatsu ryoshu (local notables who actually developed the land) ONAKATOMI no Nobukiyo, but the clan collapsed due to an internal conflict.

The actual ruler was the Onakatomi clan, a descendent of kaihatsu ryoshu (local notables who actually developed the land) ONAKATOMI no Nobukiyo, but the clan collapsed due to an internal conflict during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 美濃守護家土岐氏に押されて衰退したか。
sen.e: It can be possible that the manor was declined under the dominance of Mino no kuni Shugo (provincial constable of Mino Province), the Toki clan
It is possible that the manor declined under the dominance of the Toki clan who served as Mino no Kuni Shugo (provincial constable of Mino Province),
sen.cmt: 「can be」→「is」「was」を削除ピリオドを補足再構成
sen.e: It is possible that the manor declined under the dominance of the Toki clan who served as Mino no Kuni Shugo (provincial constable of Mino Province),

sen.j: 厚見荘と同じく、年貢は絹で収めた。
sen.e: It also paid its nengu (land tax) in silk as did Atsumi-no-so Estate.
Like Atsumi-no-so Manor, it also paid its nengu (land tax) in silk.
Like Atsumi-no-so Manor, it also paid its nengu (land tax) in silk.
